availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Daviess County, Kentucky, farmer. Daviess County, Kentucky, native. Married to Louisa B. McFarland Field. Father of Albert Field, Darius Field, Virgil Field, Beatrice M. Field, Jane I. Field, Walker Field, Robert Field, Ben Field, Weng Field, Ida Field, and Phoebe Field. Farmer in Daviess County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned fourteen enslaved persons in Daviess County in 1850. Farmer in Daviess County in 1860. Owned twenty enslaved persons (including Elliot) in Daviess County in 1860. Killed by Elliot in 1862.

Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Daviess County, District 2, p. 388A.
